intro: Psychotria pallescens, commonly known as the white psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Psychotria pallescens is often found growing in shaded understory environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
